definition: to receive/to accept/to collect/to put away/to restrain/to stop/in care of (used on address line after name)
to go and return/to return/to resume/to return to a normal or original state/to repeat/again/to recover/to restore/to turn over/to reply/to answer/to reply to a letter/to retaliate/to carry out
variant of 復|复[fu4]/to reply to a letter

sentences.english: The meeting is disrupted by Albanian irredentist.
sentences.chinese: 会议被阿尔巴尼亚的领土收复主义者所中断。

sentences.english: Skeptics say Chinese bank stocks might not recover their lost ground.
sentences.chinese: 怀疑论者认为，中资银行股或许无法收复失地。

sentences.english: Fight to the finish for the recovery of Peiping, Tientsin and northeastern China.
sentences.chinese: 为收复平津和东北而血战到底。

sentences.english: The soldiers recaptured the city lost to the enemy.
sentences.chinese: 士兵们收复被敌人攻占的城市。

sentences.english: The recovery of the Xisha and Nansha Islands is the major achievement during the anti-aggression war in China.
sentences.chinese: 收复西南沙群岛是中国反侵略战争胜利的重要成果。

sentences.english: It touched off a nationwide movement for the recovery of railway rights.
sentences.chinese: 这在全国引起了收复铁路修筑权的运动。

sentences.english: Qing hero Zheng Chenggong, recovering around the world to see.
sentences.chinese: 清初英雄郑成功，收复台湾世界见。

sentences.english: Throughout Zong 's life, the most glorious is to recover 1/6 of the national territories.
sentences.chinese: 纵观左宗棠的一生，最辉煌的是收复六分之一的国土。

sentences.english: L is taken as a plant available to live in abandoned land in arid region.
sentences.chinese: 黄花蒿可作为干旱地区收复弃耕地的先锋植物。

sentences.english: After a few years, the king reoccupied his land and came into power again.
sentences.chinese: 几年后，昭王收复失土，又回到国内主持政务。

sentences.english: The city fell into enemy hands in April, and was regained in September.
sentences.chinese: 这座城市于4月陷入敌手，于9月收复。

sentences.english: China neither recognized Manchukuo nor was able to recover Manchuria .
sentences.chinese: 中国不承认满洲国也无法收复满洲。

sentences.english: ZuChengXun to belittle the Japanese, so-called can quickly retrieve Pyongyang.
sentences.chinese: 祖承训轻视日军，号称可以迅速收复平壤。

sentences.english: They won the battle and resumed lost territory.
sentences.chinese: 他们打胜了这一仗并收复了失地。

sentences.english: His battle-tested skill equipped the troops to reclaim Europe.
sentences.chinese: 他丰富的作战经验，使他的部队得以收复欧洲。

sentences.english: Yoo sung-ryong think recovered the city first, then talk about the problem the army command.
sentences.chinese: 柳成龙认为先收复平壤城再谈军队指挥问题。

definition: (military) (of a city etc) to fall into enemy hands/(fig.) to take a turn for the worse
to seize control of (an enemy position)/(fig.) to take by storm/to gain (awards, control of a market etc)
to recover (territory or power)/the liberation of Taiwan from Japanese rule in 1945
Guangfu or Kuangfu township in Hualien County 花蓮縣|花莲县[Hua1 lian2 Xian4], east Taiwan
to lose what one has just obtained (idiom)
Pingding county in Yangquan 陽泉|阳泉[Yang2 quan2], Shanxi
to take back (forcibly)/to recapture/to win back
to follow up a victory/to pursue retreating enemy
